thread.title: Denver-born sitcom “Those Who Can’t” picked up for third season on truTV
thread.title_full: Denver-born sitcom “Those Who Can’t” picked up for third season on truTV

author: Dylan Owens
title: Denver-born sitcom “Those Who Can’t” picked up for third season on truTV
text:
Aurora police confirm body found in pond is missing 6-year-old boy Provided by truTV The Denver-based comedy team The Grawlix, from l-r, Adam Cayton-Holland, Andrew Orvedahl and Ben Roy, in an image from the Amazon version of their sitcom pilot, which has now been picked up for a third season on truTV. 
Say a prayer to the gods of sitcom television, Denver comedy fans: “Those Who Can’t” is coming back for a third season. 
On Thursday, truTV announced it had greenlit the show, which was developed by Denver comedy troupe The Grawlix, for thirteen more episodes. Season three is anticipated to premiere in late 2017. 
The Grawlix’s Adam Cayton-Holland, Andrew Orvedahl and Ben Roy, who star as dysfunctional high school teachers in the show, took to Twitter to share the news: WHOO HOO: Those Who Can’t will return for a season three! Thank you to everyone who has watched and supported the show up to this point! 
— Andrew O. (@TheOrvedahl) January 5, 2017 

Here it is announced on @Deadline . Thank you friends, fans, and trutv for making Season 3 of #thosewhocant happen! https://t.co/GVatfF30TZ 
— Ben Roy (@benroy00) January 5, 2017 

— Adam Cayton-Holland (@CaytonHolland) January 5, 2017 

Despite a wealth of guest appearances from the upper-reaches of a weird bracket of the—comedy world (Kyle Kinane, Rory Scovel, Patton Oswalt et al.), the—fate of “Those Who Can’t” had been uncertain since—the finale of its second season aired on truTV last month. 
If you’ve missed out on the show and call yourself a Denverite, well, shame on you. Catch up on your homework before season three via truTV.com , which is streaming all episodes of “Those Who Can’t” right now. 
Read our feature on how—”Those Who Can’t” came to be here . Tags:
